docs.abstract: The prime minister and his party question the broadcaster’s reliance on fees paid by viewers. They are increasingly at odds with its journalism, too.
docs.snippet: The prime minister and his party question the broadcaster’s reliance on fees paid by viewers. They are increasingly at odds with its journalism, too.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The British Broadcasting Corporation has long been one of Britain’s most revered institutions. But after an election campaign in which it faced charges of bias, the media organization finds its future in the hands of some of its biggest critics.

headline.main: With Echoes of Trump, Boris Johnson Scorns the BBC
headline.print_headline: Britain’s Right (and Left) Heap Scorn on BBC

docs.abstract: Chevron’s multibillion-dollar write-down of gas assets is the most recent sign that the gas supply has far outstripped demand.
docs.snippet: Chevron’s multibillion-dollar write-down of gas assets is the most recent sign that the gas supply has far outstripped demand.
docs.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — A decade ago, natural gas was heralded as the fuel of the future. In shale fields across the country, hydraulic fracturing uncorked a lucrative new source of supply. Energy giants like Exxon Mobil and Chevron snapped up smaller companies to get in on the action, and investors poured billions of dollars into export terminals to ship gas to China and Europe.

headline.main: Natural Gas Boom Fizzles as a U.S. Glut Sinks Profits
headline.print_headline: Glut Marks End of Natural Gas Boom

docs.abstract: A new report documents the concentration of cutting-edge industries in a few coastal areas and why lawmakers ought to be alarmed.
docs.snippet: A new report documents the concentration of cutting-edge industries in a few coastal areas and why lawmakers ought to be alarmed.
docs.lead_paragraph: There are about a dozen industries at the frontier of innovation. They include software and pharmaceuticals, semiconductors and data processing. Most of their workers have science or tech degrees. They invest heavily in research and development. While they account for only 3 percent of all jobs, they account for 6 percent of the country’s economic output.

headline.main: A Few Cities Have Cornered Innovation Jobs. Can That Be Changed?

docs.abstract: Beijing’s pursuit of control over a Muslim ethnic group pushes the rules of science and raises questions about consent.
docs.snippet: Beijing’s pursuit of control over a Muslim ethnic group pushes the rules of science and raises questions about consent.
docs.lead_paragraph: TUMXUK, China — In a dusty city in the Xinjiang region on China’s western frontier, the authorities are testing the rules of science.

headline.main: China Uses DNA to Map Faces, With Help From the West
headline.print_headline: China Mines DNA To Map Out Faces With West’s Help

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Ministry of Public Security of the People's Republic of China

byline.original: By Sui-Lee Wee and Paul Mozur

docs.abstract: Developers are clamoring for storefront space as they seek to provide one-of-a-kind experiences for shoppers.
docs.snippet: Developers are clamoring for storefront space as they seek to provide one-of-a-kind experiences for shoppers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Five years ago, Eli Gindi, a New York businessman, learned that part of the Showcase Mall on the Las Vegas Strip was up for sale. His interest piqued, he informally toured the property a few weeks later while in town for business.

headline.main: On Las Vegas Strip, Splashy Stores Elbow In Alongside Casinos
headline.print_headline: New Stores Add Their Own Glitter to Las Vegas

docs.abstract: He was a conservative monetary economist and a Carnegie Mellon professor who took on policy roles. His nomination lapsed after he failed to win Senate support.
docs.snippet: He was a conservative monetary economist and a Carnegie Mellon professor who took on policy roles. His nomination lapsed after he failed to win Senate support.
docs.lead_paragraph: Marvin Goodfriend, a leading conservative monetary economist and former nominee to the Federal Reserve Board, died on Thursday at his home in Pittsburgh. He was 69.

headline.main: Marvin Goodfriend, Trump Nominee to the Federal Reserve, Dies at 69
headline.print_headline: Marvin Goodfriend, 69, a Trump Nominee to the Federal Reserve

docs.abstract: Congressional Democrats and the White House are on the cusp of an agreement on revisions to the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement.
docs.snippet: Congressional Democrats and the White House are on the cusp of an agreement on revisions to the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Democratic lawmakers are nearing an agreement to bring the revised North American free trade deal to a vote after securing additional labor, enforcement and other provisions and winning the support of top labor leaders.

headline.main: Democrats Close to Agreement With White House on New NAFTA

byline.original: By Emily Cochrane, Ana Swanson, Elisabeth Malkin and Maggie Haberman

docs.abstract: If you didn’t change the tax withholding in your paycheck, you still have time to avoid another unpleasant surprise — or even a fine.
docs.snippet: If you didn’t change the tax withholding in your paycheck, you still have time to avoid another unpleasant surprise — or even a fine.
docs.lead_paragraph: The first tax season under the Republican-sponsored overhaul brought an odd combination of pleasant and unpleasant surprises: lower tax burdens, but also lower refunds — and, for some, an unexpected bill.

headline.main: Last Tax Season Was a Mess. Now’s Time to Prepare for This One.
headline.print_headline: Last Call to Update Your W-4 and Avoid a Tax Bite

docs.abstract: His video message acknowledged “a lot of pressure to return this aircraft to service” but told workers to “focus solely on safety.”
docs.snippet: His video message acknowledged “a lot of pressure to return this aircraft to service” but told workers to “focus solely on safety.”
docs.lead_paragraph: As the grounding of Boeing’s 737 Max enters its eighth month, the company has been pressing the Federal Aviation Administration to speed up its approval of a fix that is necessary to return the plane to service.

headline.main: F.A.A. Chief Urges Employees to Resist Pressure to End Max’s Grounding
headline.print_headline: F.A.A. Loath To Rush Test To Clear Max

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Boeing 737 Max Groundings and Safety Concerns (2019)

byline.original: By Natalie Kitroeff and David Gelles

docs.abstract: Facebook, Microsoft, Twitter and others are spending millions on video game streaming to compete with Amazon’s Twitch in a fight to court millennials.
docs.snippet: Facebook, Microsoft, Twitter and others are spending millions on video game streaming to compete with Amazon’s Twitch in a fight to court millennials.
docs.lead_paragraph: Microsoft paid millions to lure a top video game streaming star. Facebook signed an exclusive streaming deal with the largest e-sports company in the world. Twitter streamed Fortnite’s collapse into a black hole.

headline.main: Why Twitch Is Still the King of Live Game Streaming
headline.print_headline: It’s Tech Giants Vs. the King of Streaming
